intro: Festuca ovina var. coreana, commonly known as Korean sheep fescue, is a perennial grass species native to Korea. It is characterized by its fine, dense foliage and tufted growth habit, making it a popular choice for ornamental and turfgrass applications. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is drought-tolerant and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it adaptable to various environmental conditions. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to form a dense, soft-textured lawn or ground cover.
